abstracts.cdata!:
The Agricultural Reform Implementation
            Support (ARIS) project will: (a) create and strengthen the
            most critical agricultural support services to accelerate
            the implementation of ongoing and future agricultural
            reforms; (b) to build analytical and institutional capacity
            to identify, appraise and implement agricultural and
            agro-business projects by the private sector on the basis of
            economic criteria; and (c) to demonstrate the role that the
            private sector can play in promoting efficiency in the
            agro-industrial sector. The support services will focus on:
            (i) the creation of an enabling policy environment for
            private sector participation in seed and market development;
            (ii) establishment of a nationwide market information
            system; (iii) establishment of farmer information and
            advisory services. The role of the private sector will be
            demonstrated by selective "pilot" investments in
            hybrid corn and sunflower seed enterprises, fruit and
            vegetable marketing bases and vegetable storage facilities.
            The provision of critical support service, the development
            of analytical capacity and demonstration of the commercial
            viability of participating private enterprises are expected
            to lay the foundation for an efficient agricultural sector
            based on private ownership and market principle.
